message: How does the PCDS 2030 plan aim to achieve social inclusivity for all Sarawakians, and what specific strategies or initiatives are outlined to support this goal?
response: Thinking… (click to collapse) I will research the PCDS 2030 plan for social inclusivity strategies. Key constraints include limited information on the plan's specifics. Assuming the plan is publicly available, I will outline its initiatives. I’ve performed an information search and found the following: The PCDS 2030 plan aims to achieve social inclusivity for all Sarawakians by implementing various strategies and initiatives. Some of the specific initiatives outlined in the plan include: Bantuan Khas Sarawakku Sayang (BKSS) packages: The Sarawak Government has implemented nine BKSS packages, totaling RM6.7 billion, to alleviate the financial burden of the people and business community during the COVID-19 pandemic. These packages include cash assistance, discounts on utility bills, fee waivers, and deferment of payment for land premiums and loan schemes. Endowment Fund Sarawak (EFS): The EFS provides a grant of RM1,000 in the form of savings for every Sarawakian baby born starting from 2019, to assist with higher education, starting a career, or as seed capital for small businesses.
